page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA.
This block covers the north of Rushden,the west of Higham Ferrers and a large part of the valley of the river Nene.The area is mainly farmland and rough pasture and about 20% residential.The ground is flat and forms a narrow plain covered in soils of clay,alluvium and loam.The river Nene is roughly 16m wide and winds across its flood plain.Other water in the area includes Ditchford Lake,Skew Bridge Ski Club and a small lake in the grounds of Knuston Hall.The town of Rushden itself has a population of about 26,000 with houses that eventually thin out to become farmland.Local farms include Grange Farm,Redgate Farm,South View Farm and Home Farm.
